text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Syrian newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Arab League council decides halting normalisation of ties with Israel, declares all Israeli measures in Golan as null and void and condemns Jewish settlements in Arab East Jerusalem.
- Syrian Foreign Minister Farouq al-Shara says Israel's occupation of Arab lands and peace can never go together.
- Arab foreign ministers stress confidence-building should be based on Middle East peace process.
- Oman says it will heed Arab decisions on Israel ties.
- Israel is angry at the Arab League decisions and is studying ways to reply.
- Syrian Information Minister Mohammad Salman discusses cooperation with a visiting Iranian information delegation.
- Syrian Prime Minister Mahmoud Zu'bi and Libyan finance minister Mohamed Beit al-Mal discuss cooperation and bilateral ties.
- Syrian Agriculture Ministry plans to export products worth $2.5 million in 1997.
- Syrian industrial exports were $68 million in 1996.
- Syria is planning to produce around 1.3 million tonnes of sugar beet in 1997.
- Preparations start for the European-Mediterranean partnership conference due later in April.

- Former U.S. secretary of state James Baker says Syria will not accept anything but full withdrawal from the Golan and that late Israeli prime minister Yitzhak Rabin had told U.S. President Bill Clinton that he was ready for withdrawal.
